item.title: NostraDavid's Knowledge Base - Javascript code snippets and regex
item.description: For now (2020-07-16) it’s just snippets of JS and regex that I use every now and then I’d use GitHub for that, but I have a tendency to forget GitHub Gist exists… Open all chapters Close all chapters Online Tools These are websites/webpages that I use to optimize this site. Tool name What to use it for SVGOMG! “SVG Optimizer’s Missing GUI”, an online SVG optimizer Google’s Closure Compiler A Javascript optimizer - turns modern JS into highly optimized, yet compatible, Javascript.

<!doctype html> On Computable Numbers, with an Application to the Entscheidungsproblem | The Thaumatorium ON COMPUTABLE NUMBERS, WITH AN APPLICATION TO THE ENTSCHEIDUNGSPROBLEM By A. M. TURING. [Received 28 May, 1936.—Read 12 November, 1936.] The “computable” numbers may be described briefly as the real numbers whose expressions as a decimal are calculable by finite means. Although the subject of this paper is ostensibly the computable numbers, it is almost equally easy to define and investigate computable functions of an integral variable or a real or computable variable, computable predicates, and so forth.

<!doctype html> The Unabomber Trial: The Manifesto | The Thaumatorium The Thaumatorium: Where the magic happens Last updated: Main nav menu Frontpage - Articles - Projects - Experimentations - Code of Conduct - Random video - Hardware - Knowledge Base - About This page is not publically accessible because people will think I support his terrorst actions, because people are idiots. I just want to figure out what made this man tic.

<!doctype html> Cryptocurrencies, Exchanges and Technical Analysis | The Thaumatorium The Thaumatorium: Where the magic happens Main nav menu Frontpage - Articles - Projects - Experimentations - Code of Conduct - Random video - Hardware - Knowledge Base - About Cryptocurrencies, Exchanges and Technical Analysis Published: 2020-07-17 Author: NostraDavid History and context I know about crypto since 2010-ish, back when Bitcoin was the only coin in town. I always wanted to buy some, but never had money left to spend, due to either no income (because student) or because my job wasn't paying enough and I had to pay off my student loans (which weren't that big back then - not compared to what I have now, lmao).
